channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Trees overgro3n, 27th July
item.description:
The trees need cutting back half way up longbury close. They have not been done for a while and you need to practically walk in the road as no space on the pavement
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Longbury Close, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Line bikes blocking entire footpath, 27th July
item.description:
So many irresponsible line bike users dumping bikes wherever they could - blocked the footpath for pedestrians, disabled and children Please enforce the rules, this is a for profit organisation, blocking our streets.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Englefield Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Paving slabs missing where a tree stump has been removed, 27th July
item.description:
A tree stump has been removed and the paving slabs have not been replaced. This is a trip hazard and dangerous for pedestrians. This has been the case for over 18 months. Please arrange for paving slabs to be installed
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gautrey Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Standing water in ladies toilets, 27th July
item.description:
Yesterday the ladies toilets had half an inch of water in all cubicles. Today it has gone down a bit but still there. They are also very dirty.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kelsey Park Avenue, Beckenham, London

item.title: Cigarette butts thrown from balcony, 27th July
item.description:
Tenants from the top floor, between 65-69 St Lawrence Court N1 5TP throw their cigarettes when still lit. A few occasions have nearly been hit by one. Very dangerous and disgusting. Ground below is littered with butts.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): De Beauvoir Estate, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 27th July
item.description:
Someone has dumped furniture and other items at the end of Kingston Crescent, next to the Norton Court building. Opposite 48 Kingston Crescent. Please clear asap before more appears. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingston Crescent, Beckenham, London

item.title: Dumped items and fly-tipping outside 85A Garland Road, 27th July
item.description:
There has been ongoing fly-tipping in front of our property at 85A Garland Road, SE18 2PL for about a month. Items left include a doormat, bags of clothing, rubbish placed in our bin, shoes, and most recently a bed left last night. This is causing hygiene issues and blocking access to our door. Could the council please arrange for these items to be removed and monitor the area?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pendrell Street, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
